channel.title: Community Tools
channel.description:
Hi all,
so, there are plenty of tools for RSC servers, none of them perfect. i was wondering if anyone would be interested in creating a fund, all of us donating money, and using that money to get some cheap asian programmers to create us what we want? or even create an android RSC client, or anything really. i don't think it would cost us a whole heap and we release them open source as community tools

item.title: Community Tools
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

If I were Moparisthebest, I’d have a hard time justifying payment for RSC tools when there are so few who would gain from them. Unfortunately this community is subject to the whims of a handful of people who make it impossible to operate a server (and prohibitively expensive to even get one up and running and playable).

Read full topic

item.title: Community Tools
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Send me your money

Read full topic

item.title: Community Tools
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“The Enforcer, post:9, topic:519927”]Don’t hire those indians. My co-worker hired some indians for his personal projects and he did not have good time with them.

They write shit and unmaintainable code, code that only they can understand. So if you need modifications or updates, you’re stuck with them because only they can decipher that shit.

They might just disappear randomly, various reasons. If you pay too much, they’re gonna start travelling and partying. This one indian - he disappeared for a month. And when asked where he was. He was drunk driving and hit the indian prime minister’s daughter with his car and had to spend a month in jail. So as you can see there are too many dangers.[/quote]I always love your posts… <3

Read full topic

item.title: Community Tools
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

Don’t hire those indians. My co-worker hired some indians for his personal projects and he did not have good time with them.

They write shit and unmaintainable code, code that only they can understand. So if you need modifications or updates, you’re stuck with them because only they can decipher that shit.

They might just disappear randomly, various reasons. If you pay too much, they’re gonna start travelling and partying. This one indian - he disappeared for a month. And when asked where he was. He was drunk driving and hit the indian prime minister’s daughter with his car and had to spend a month in jail. So as you can see there are too many dangers.

Read full topic

The problem here is that it’s rsc…

item.title: Community Tools
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:5, topic:519927”][quote author=Crooks link=topic=638420.msg4303377#msg4303377 date=1369362220]
Sure could be doable… But I don’t think anyone trust anyone to hold any money (specific person) and believe this person to contact these Asian programmers and pay them, so how would that work out?

If you come up with a way that is reasonable, then sure I could throw in a couple of hundreds.
[/quote]

good point, im sure we can find someone though. but definitely not a couple of hundred, i was thinking more like 20 bucks each.

Lol, I laughed when I read “Cheap asian programmers”.

Tell MITB to do it. He get’s tons of money each month saved up for his “Runescape 2 Server” that sits in the bank account not touched for when he puts one up.

India is one of the last places to get a programmer for under $5 an hour these days

I doubt MITB would spend money on this stuff, he would have done it with rs2 already instead of getting the community to make junk[/quote]Actually, they cost a decent amount for anything that doesn’t take 5 minutes.

Try posting on some freelance sites, and you’ll see what I mean.

Read full topic

Seems like wasting money/effort. Admit it, RSC is practically dead.
